Smart Answer Sheet Alignment and Evaluation System
(SASES)
Background
Educational institutions worldwide process millions of answer sheets annually using digital evaluation
systems. Despite technological advancements, two persistent challenges remain:
• Scanned Answer Sheet Alignment – Student answer sheets often suffer from distortions
(skew, scaling, perspective shifts, noise), leading to poor alignment with the original question
template.
• Automated Evaluation of Structured Questions – Current systems struggle to auto-grade
handwritten answers for MCQs, fill-in-the-blanks, or one-word responses, resulting in manual
intervention and reduced scalability.
Problem Statement
Developamulti-agentic AI systemthatintegratesimageprocessing,computervision,andAI/LLM
components to:
• Automatically correctly align scanned handwritten student answer sheets to match the original
question paper template.
• Extract and evaluate answers for structured question types (MCQ, fill-in-the-blank, one-word
response) by comparing them with a reference answer script.
• Produce interpretable outputs including: aligned student sheet, transformation parameters,
alignment accuracy, and auto-evaluation results.
Problem Description
When students’ handwritten answer sheets are scanned for digital evaluation, multiple issues compro-
mise both the alignment and the evaluation process.
Common Distortions (Alignment Issues) Include:
(cid:136) Skewness: Papers placed at angles during scanning (–15(cid:176) rotation).
(cid:136) Perspective Distortion: Non-flat placement causing trapezoidal effects.
(cid:136) Scale Variations: Different scanner settings or paper sizes (–10% variation).
(cid:136) Translation Shifts: Papers not aligned with scanner edges (x,y displacement).
1
(cid:136) Padding/Margins: Inconsistent white space around content.
(cid:136) Paper Deformations: Wrinkles, folds, or curves in the paper.
(cid:136) Noise & Artifacts: Scanner dust, shadows, compression artifacts.
(cid:136) Contrast/Brightness Variations: Due to scanning or lighting differences.
Common Distortions (Issues in Auto-Evaluation) Include:
(cid:136) Handwriting Variability: Differences in writing style, spacing, and slant.
(cid:136) Spelling Variations: Minor spelling mistakes or synonyms in fill-in-the-blank answers.
(cid:136) Answer Positioning Errors: Writing outside designated boxes or overlapping with questions.
(cid:136) Overwriting/Strikethroughs: Multiple attempts in the same space causing ambiguity.
(cid:136) Multiple Markings in MCQs: Ambiguous ticks, erasures, or use of unclear symbols.
(cid:136) Faint/Blurred Writing: Pencil answers or faint ink reducing recognition accuracy.
(cid:136) Noise Interference: Smudges, ink bleeding, or scanning shadows.
(cid:136) Reference Script Rigidity: Strict matching may not account for valid alternate answers.
Technical Requirements
Input:
(cid:136) Original question paper template.
(cid:136) Scanned student answer sheet.
(cid:136) Reference answer script.
Expected Output:
(cid:136) Correctly aligned answer sheet image.
(cid:136) Transformation parameters applied.
(cid:136) Alignment accuracy/confidence score.
(cid:136) Auto-evaluated results with per-question marks.
Constraints
(cid:136) Preserve all student handwriting without loss.
(cid:136) Support standard document formats (JPEG, PNG).
(cid:136) Maintain resolution ≥ 300 DPI.
(cid:136) No specialized hardware required.
2
Bonus Challenges
(cid:136) Multi-page support for stapled booklets.
(cid:136) Damage recovery for torn or faded sheets.
(cid:136) Real-time preview of alignment corrections.
(cid:136) Handwriting readability enhancement.
(cid:136) Automated validation: flagging uncertain cases for manual review.
(cid:136) Explainable evaluation: showing why a response was marked correct/incorrect.
Deliverables
(cid:136) Working prototype/application.
(cid:136) Source code with documentation.
(cid:136) Test results on provided dataset.
(cid:136) Technical approach document (with agent responsibilities).
(cid:136) Draft of the research paper (If innovations are involved in the process)
(cid:136) Demo video (3–5 minutes).
